attributes.action: Reduce the UK's foreign aid budget from 0.7% GDP to 0.1% GDP.
attributes.background: Increase Social Care Funding by reducing the UK's foreign aid budget from 0.7% GDP £12 Billion Pounds to 0.1% GDP £1.714  Billion Pounds. The remaining 0.6% of GDP £10.285 Billion Pounds could then be used to increase funding for Social Care and improve the quality of life of British Citizens.

attributes.action: Fine neglectful parents who send there children to school when child is unwell.
attributes.background: Change the law and fine parents that send there child to school when the child is unwell or ill. Not meeting the child's needs is classed as neglect. Children will not learn when they feel poorly and they spread germs to other healthy children.
attributes.additional_details:
Neglect
In this type of child maltreatment there is a failure to provide for a child's basic physical or emotional needs, which is likely to damage the child's health or development.
Not helping a child to have the medical care or treatment that they need. This includes having their normal routine immunisations and attending hospital appointments. It also includes not giving them medication which has been prescribed.

Copy from in part.  http://patient.info/health/safeguarding-children

attributes.action: Make law that parents are financially accountable for their childrens behaviour
attributes.background: Parents have a duty to bring up our children to be good law abiding citizens. But laws do not encourage this, a child can be brought up an cause, criminal damage, theft and even hospitalise people without any come back on the parents. Adults need to be accountable for parenting performance.
attributes.additional_details: Poorly brought up children cost the country and tax payers a vast amount of money. Graffitti alone in London last year cost over £100m, criminal damage, theft and crimes relating to injury should all hold the parents financially accountable. Criminal damage by children is not paid for by the parents, so insurance goes up. Unless the laws of this country encourage the outcome we want then some parents will continue to perform badly as parents and future generations will suffer.

attributes.action: Support Community Radio/Media organisations with a substantive funding increase.
attributes.background: There are now over 240 Ofcom licensed Community Radio/Media organisations across the UK, many of whom are struggling and increasingly having to commercialise their operations to survive, against the spirit and original intent of Community Radio since inception in 2002/04. http://tiny.cc/comradiofund
attributes.additional_details: In addition to a substantive funding increase, a relaxation in the associated constraints on Community Radio Fund grant use (ie. what it can and cannot be spent on) is also sought. http://tiny.cc/comradiofund

attributes.action: Review the PIPs scoring system as being Dickensian & unfair in the 21st century.
attributes.background: The current review system is bias & unfair against disabled people who rely highly on access to places that abled people enjoy on a daily basis.
attributes.additional_details: Disabled people are made to feel like criminals during & following the reviews. They're made to apply for this benefit in a totally bias and unfair way on a claim form which asks 10 questions towards daily living but only 2 on mobility, which is the main purpose for disabled people applying for this benefit, in the first place. Maybe, if there must be 12 questions, a balance of 6 for daily living & 6 for mobility would be fairer & maybe provide a better view of a individuals needs?

attributes.action: Allow N.Ireland and ROI citizens to receive free abortions on the NHS England
attributes.background: The 1967 Abortion Act, which established legal abortion, has never applied in Northern Ireland, and in the Republic of Ireland abortion is illegal unless to save the life of the mother. This means that Irish women often have to travel to mainland Britain for privately funded abortions.
attributes.additional_details: Marie Stopes, the UK's biggest abortion provider, has just announced that it will be deprioritising Irish women who travel to their clinics seeking abortions. Irish women cannot undergo abortions on the NHS; the cost of private treatment, coupled with the expense of travel, means that abortion is only available to Irish women who can afford the expense. The UK has always enjoyed a special relationship with Ireland, and the right to free NHS England abortions should be extended to Irish women.

attributes.action: Increase income tax & CGT by 1% then raise NHS spending by 10%
attributes.background: It has become overwhelmingly apparent to the electorate that the NHS is struggling to function with many people left bedridden in corridors, operations cancelled and lifesaving treatments being denied to those most in need.
attributes.additional_details:
With 2015 total tax receipts being £533bn of which 56% is raised through Income Tax, NI & CBT. We believe a 1% raise on the 3 tiers of income tax as well as CGT will raise sufficient funding to increase spending on our NHS by no less than 10%. 

Government Tax Receipts:
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/539194/Jun16_Receipts_NS_Bulletin_Final.pdf 

NHS Deficit:
https://www.kingsfund.org.uk/publications/deficits-nhs-2016

attributes.action: For Brexit Success: Abolish Business Rates and Make Up The Difference in VAT.
attributes.background: UK Businesses are grossly overcharged in business rates without bearing on the revenue they generate. Almost 4% of UK GDP is from these rates, verses 0.65% in the rest of Europe. UK businesses have to charge more to compensate, making them less competitive. Move to VAT would level the playing field.
attributes.additional_details:
[1]http://moneyweek.com/its-time-to-abolish-business-rates/
[2]https://www.retail-week.com/topics/policy-and-legal/uk-has-the-highest-business-rates-bill-across-eu-says-report/5049347.article
[3]http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/11912104/George-Osborne-unveils-radical-business-rates-overhaul.html
[4]http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/retailandconsumer/11815278/Business-tsar-backs-plea-for-business-rates-cut.html
For a small change in VAT the burden is removed from British Business.

attributes.action: Clearly state, at point of use, if NHS service is provided by the private sector
attributes.background:
The government is not being transparent regarding the number of NHS services being provided by the private sector. 

If a private company uses the NHS logo and provides an inadequate service, the reputation of the NHS is harmed.
attributes.additional_details:
I have worked in the NHS for 20 years. After the introduction of marketisation within the NHS, a huge amount of services have been contracted out. This trend is increasing. 
The cheapest provider is not always the best for improving services. Private companies withing to gain NHS contracts should have to provide EVIDENCE that they can deliver. They should be held to account when they fail. A halt on further NHS contracts to those companies would be a good idea.

attributes.action: I want a BAN on any child under 10 being allowed their ears pieced.
attributes.background: So by law if you were to put holes in another human beings body without permission then you'd be arrested for bodily harm, but parents believe they have the right to be doing this to babies and children, why can't a child have the right to ask for it to be done and choose to ruin their own bodies.
attributes.additional_details: A child starts hitting puberty around 10 which is when there body starts forming and it wouldn't make too much difference in piercing their ears. They'd be less likely to quickly move or cause damage or infection and you'd know there allergies (I.e Gold) by then, a child should be able to ask, especially as if they choose they don't like them they'll be left with either holes or scars on their ears all because there parents pierced them without permission while so young. It's assault.

attributes.action: Make it that child maintenance payments come with visitation rights.
attributes.background: I pay maintenance for my children but still get stopped from seeing them. If the other parent takes payment from you you are entitled to see them without a court order if you are stopped from seeing them then payments should be reduced

attributes.action: Permanently seize any vehicle used by a drink/drug driver following a conviction
attributes.background: Once a person is convicted of drink/drug driving they keep the vehicle that was used during the commission of the offence. This could be following a 12 - 24 month ban passed by a court. The vehicle will usually remain outside the home address of the person convicted, until temptation to use it hits.

attributes.action: Make the National Lottery a direct fund of the National Health Service
attributes.background: Lottery money paid by all Citizens to be the income of the National Health Service

attributes.action: Allow the President of the United States to visit the UK to create trade options
attributes.background: Banning Donald Trump from entering the UK would diminish the chances of creating a competitive trade deal with the EU. Put differences aside and try and boost the UK's negotiation position at this crucial time. Donald Trump will leave office one day.
attributes.additional_details: The EU will soon enter into negotiations with the U.K.  To make sure that a competitive deal is reached that can benefit both sides, there needs to be viable alternatives. The United States is the largest economy in the world. To limit trade ties would be a waste just because the President has ideological differences. One day Donald Trump will leave office and it would have been a waste to sideline the President, Donald Trump has already expressed interest in UK trade.

attributes.action: Core travel infrastructure should seek ACAS approval prior to strike action
attributes.background: 2016 has seen various industrial strike actions due various industrial disputes. The Government should appoint an independent body i.e. ACAS (Advisory, Conciliation & Arbitration Service) to mediate between core travel businesses and Unions to ensure that any strike action is avoided where possible.
attributes.additional_details:
2016 saw an increase in strike action a total of 269,000 days lost due to industrial action since October 2016. This is over a 50% increase to the figures of 2015 which is 169,000 days lost due to industrial action (figures from Office for National Statistics)
Core travel infrastructure industrial actions needs to assure that Unions voices are heard with assurance that their request to strike are reasonable & limited. Strike action causes increased travel time and costs to thousands of commuters

attributes.action: Implement a 20% tariff on all goods imported from the United States of America
attributes.background:
After a row over who would pay for a wall between the USA & Mexico, a bilateral summit between the two nations was cancelled by the Mexican president.
In response, President Trump now seeks to impose a 20% tariff on all Mexican goods.
In response the UK should impose a similar penalty on the USA.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is to ask the house to debate the imposition of a similarly punitive trade tariff as that which President Trump wishes to impose on Mexico. The whole world needs to stand up to bullies and the UK should lead by example.

The last time the world appeased a bully, 80 years ago, it didn't end well.

attributes.action: Before any vote on Article 50 the government must publish the trade consequences
attributes.background: MP's would be stupid to trigger Article 50 without first knowing the trade rules that would come into effect as a result. The referendum ballot did not permit MP's to be irresponsible. The public have a right to know what trade rules MPs will put in place if they decide to vote to trigger Article 50
attributes.additional_details: Only 37% of the electorate voted "leave". The vast majority of the electorate want conditions to improve following any parliamentary vote on Article 50. MPs must be able to assure the public that if they vote to trigger Article 50, trading relations will not be worsened and restrictions will not be placed on financial institutions that will damage our economy. Therefore before any parliamentary vote on Article 50, MPs must publish in full all the arrangements that will then come into effect.

attributes.action: Allow all Mains Post Offices in the UK to be able to issue passport forms.
attributes.background: Many main Post Offices are being asked for Passport forms on a daily basis. We undertake every other aspect of travel : insurance, currency, travel money cards and credit cards. Why do we have to send customers to competitors when we could issue and check and send passports?
attributes.additional_details: We want a level playing field for all main Post Offices who would all offer this essential service.

attributes.action: Make recycling for all businesses compulsory and easily accessible
attributes.background: Cost-effective recycling is a particular problem for small businesses, which often cannot access residential recycling schemes run by councils and may not be big enough to gain attractive contracts for waste disposal from large providers. Landfill tax has risen to £84.40 but this isn't working.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government continually increasing the rate to encourage businesses to recycle more of their waste isn't enough.The Federation of Small Businesses (FSB) highlighted this issue, calling for free waste recycling for micro-businesses. The organisation is also calling for better access for all SMEs.

60% of waste that goes to landfill could have been recycled. If the Government want to increase consumption in our economy then they need to do something about it from an environmental point.

attributes.action: Stop DWP removing Motability cars before the Appeal Process is exhausted.
attributes.background: Motability car drivers are disadvantaged when PIP assessments mean they can no longer keep their cars.
attributes.additional_details:
Personal Independence Payment (PIP) assessment means disabled people are quite often assessed at the standard rate for mobility. This means they are no longer entitled to a Motability vehicle. The letter informing them of this gives them four weeks to return their cars. 

If their reconsideration and/or appeal is successful, they will have given up their cars for nothing. 

Please find a way to help these people keep their cars until a final appeal is unsuccessful.

attributes.action: Hold a general election as so we can vote on the policies of Brexit.
attributes.background: We are facing Brexit whether you voted for it or not. Now we need to vote on the terms of the Brexit. An unelected leader should not lead the Brexit negations.
attributes.additional_details:
A general election should be held to allow our parties to form their plan for Brexit allowing the electorate to have a say with the power of a vote. 

An unelected leader is not the right person for the job.

attributes.action: Remove the unecessary, excessively armed, MoD presence in Scotland
attributes.background: The Rosneath peninsula in Scotland is home to a widely unpopular military installation. The MoD have, with little to no consultation with the local population, increased their presence in the region. This needs to be undone handing back Scottish policing to Police Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: In a move the government has justified with maintaining national security more weapons and officers with more of a will to use them are being placed in rural Scotland. This is supposedly to defend a military installation which many Scots do not want on their land and do not want so dangerously close to their population centres.

attributes.action: Bring England in line with the rest of the UK and stop NHS prescription charges.
attributes.background: It is fundamentally unfair that citizens in England have to pay NHS prescription charges (currently £8.40) whilst in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland they are free. These charges raise less than 0.5% of the NHS budget so are negligible, we in England should receive parity with the rest of the UK

attributes.action: Urgent review of Royal Navy capabilities, with immediate action on results.
attributes.background:
The Harrier Jet was scrapped by the UK in 2010, (USA will scrap them in 2025). Our last Aircraft Carrier was scrapped in 2016.
The replacement will enter service possibly in 2020.
I want our Government to immediately find a solution to this massive capability gap and implement it without delay.
attributes.additional_details:
The Harrier Jump Jet was scrapped in 2010 (USA will scrap them in 2025).  Our last Aircraft Carrier was scrapped in 2016.
No replacement has yet entered service. The MOD accountants have left this once great Maritime Nation defenceless. Utter madness to dispose of essential defence equipment before the replacement has been thoroughly trialled and allowed to enter service.
I want our Government to immediately find a solution to this massive capability gap and implement it without delay.

attributes.action: Reclassify forced entry or attempted entry into a home as an act of terrorism.
attributes.background: The distress and terror caused by someone trying to force their way into your home is a much more real and likely occurence than any threat from those acts currently classified as terrorist. These acts, however, cause real feelings of terror in the victims with a long lasting sense of insecurity.
attributes.additional_details:
From the perspective of the victim, there are far fewer resources available for the detection and apprehension of the perpetrators than there appears to be for the equivalent action against those currently considered as terrorists.
Witnessing someone attempting to force entry to your home, leave and then return with a weapon to use in the event that you confront them is a very real and terror inducing prospect for many people in this country.
It MUST be accorded the appropriate seriousness.

attributes.action: Allow 14-15 year olds to consent to sex with someone a maximum of 3 years older
attributes.background: The age of consent is currently 16, and therefore those aged below 16 are prohibited from engaging in sexual; whether protected or unprotected. My proposal is that 14 year olds should be allowed to engage in sexual activity; but only protected, and with partners who are no more than 3 years older.
attributes.additional_details: The age of consent in the UK has been 16 since 1885. Sex education has improved since 1885, and so 14 year-olds nowadays are capable of consenting to safe sex and understand the implications. Most countries in Europe have a lower age of consent than we do, which has led to calls to reduce ours. However, I believe that this is a dangerous move with paedophilia being so common today, and so I believe that my proposal is the best option. Various US states follow legislation similar to my proposal.

attributes.action: "Remain" should not be an option if a second referendum is agreed.
attributes.background:
Including "remain" in any second referendum on the deal achieved by the UK government would only serve to undermine the governments position and be intended to prevent the UK leaving the European Union.

MPs that wish to ignore the vote of the British people should reveal themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
All too often "I respect the outcome of the referendum to leave the European Union...but" is uttered by fervent supporters of the EU.  

It is all too often accompanied by proposals of a second referendum "on the terms" of our exit from the EU; this is designed to undermine UK government negotiations and ultimately thwart the outcome of the referendum of the 23rd June 2016.

A second referendum should only be on the terms agreed to EXIT the EU.

attributes.action: Save Our Children's Centre's and say no to closures
attributes.background: Lot's of jobs are being cut to save money. If this is done then Children's Centres will be effected.
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this petition to help try and save our centres....This is not only for the parents but also for every child and member of the community who uses these places on a day to day basis.

attributes.action: Increase Defence Spending to 2.5% of GDP.
attributes.background: NATO guidelines put 2% of GDP as the minimum defence spending for NATO countries. I point out the key word: MINIMUM. 2% is the bare minimum. It is not a "target". We must endeavour to bring our capabilities back up to adequate standards after careless, thoughtless cuts in the SDSR 2010 & 2015.
attributes.additional_details: It is a simple fact that when HMS Queen Elizabeth comes into service 13 Frigates and 6 Destroyers simply won't be adequate to form a Carrier Group whilst maintaining other global operations. We require AT LEAST 8 Type 26's, 12 T-31's and another 2 Destroyers. The RAF can only muster a pathetic 36 Jets whilst Saudi was deploying 100+ daily in Yemen. We call for immediate action to boost spending to 2.5% of GDP as to regain basic, minimum capability as quickly & efficiently as possible.

attributes.action: Reverse the Government's decision to 'ban' Lettings Agency applicant/tenant fees
attributes.background: The decision by the Government to 'ban' applicant/tenant fees is poorly conceived and of little benefit to tenants or the economy of the UK. In addition, this 'ban' goes against the very grain/ideology of a 'free market' economy.
attributes.additional_details: The announced plans to 'ban' (outright) the ability for Lettings Agencies to charge fees to applicants/tenants is based on a fundamental misunderstanding by the government as to how Lettings Agencies/Landlords are required to operate. The Government implies that tenants do not have a choice as to which property they wish to rent or which agency they wish to use, which displays an inherent lack of understanding as to how the property industry functions and what is required of it.

attributes.action: Over 55's to take JSA rate if they have paid full contributions for 30 yrs plus.
attributes.background: Give people the option to take early retirement on JSA rate of they have paid full contributions for 30+years. It would enable people to take early pension they have saved and get younger people in work. It could be ERP early retirement pay so they didn't need to sign on.
attributes.additional_details: I work for the local council now aged 57. I have worked all my life and saved for my pension that was suddenly moved from 60 to 66. If I and other people like me could take optional retirement at the rate that is being paid to a adult for on JSA rate, it would help the younger people get work.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all new parents to learn CPR before leaving maternity unit
attributes.background: Any new parent should be taught CPR and basic life support skills before leaving the maternity into with their newborn child. This should include choking, unconsciousness, CPR to help increase chance of survival if the unimaginable happens.

attributes.action: Petition to make Dementia Awareness a mandatory subject in citizenship
attributes.background: I currently work in a dementia and complex needs hospital for the mental health service in the east of England. As we are aware, mental health has a stigma; and many don't realise dementia does too! Basic dementia awareness is not known to the general public. This needs to change and quickly.
attributes.additional_details:
Dementia is an umbrella term for a range of cognitive impairments, that progressively get worse over time.
According to Alzheimer's Society - "There are 850,000 people with dementia in the UK, with numbers set to rise to over 1 million by 2025. 225,000 will develop dementia this yea; that’s one every three minutes!" And most shockingly "There are over 40,000 people under 65 with dementia in the UK".

Yet, many people do not have basic understanding of the signs and symptoms for Dementia.

attributes.action: Ensure that fireworks remain unrestricted to the general public.
attributes.background: A petition to ensure that the general public can (and in future will be able to) purchase fireworks for home displays without undue restrictions.

attributes.action: Make the laws protecting chickens apply to all birds including game birds
attributes.background: The suffering of game birds being bred in tiny wire cages for shooting estates on the One Show BBC1 31 October 2016 is sickening. Birds were breaking their necks bashing their heads against the wire roofs of their tiny cages whilst trying to escape. They are then wrongly sold as free range.

attributes.action: Never sign a trade deal like CETA/TTIP which cede UK sovereignty to corporations
attributes.background: Once Brexit has completed, the UK will be able to enter into trade deals by itself. Ministerial support for TTIP/CETA which are aimed at eroding national sovereignty and giving multinational corporations the right to sue governments if policy adversely effects their profits is a serious danger.
attributes.additional_details: The main tenet of the Brexit campaign was to "take back control" from the EU. UK ministers have voiced strong support for CETA/TTIP which seems contradictory given that such trade deals put the sovereignty of government in doubt and give corporations the ability to sue governments under Investor-State Dispute Settlement powers before special international tribunals. This would effectively bring an end to the cherished principle of equality before the law, all in the name of greater profits.

attributes.action: Full pension rights for people thrown out  of the navy for living with ts person
attributes.background: Living with ts person was illegal back in 82, I was kicked out for this crime but I was 21 at the time and doing nothing wrong under cival law, now a days you get to stay in if you fall in love with a ts.I find it repugnent not to eben have had a simple sorry from the powers that be.

attributes.action: Move the Ministry for Exiting the EU to Northern England
attributes.background: It is important that the ministry has a good appreciation of the needs of the economy outside the S.E. of England where a great deal of the regeneration and products produced for export come from. It would help in the building confidence in and reinforcing the Northern Powerhouse.
attributes.additional_details: The re-balancing of the economy will be an important component of restructuring the economy after Brexit, the industrial areas of the north had traditionally been part of the successful rise of Britain as a global superpower.

attributes.action: No confidence vote in Amber Rudd for denying visa to bone marrow donor.
attributes.background: May Brown, 23, from Dorset, who has leukaemia, has been told that her Nigerian sister Martha is a "10 out of 10" tissue match.  However, the Home Office denied a visa because "all visa applications must be assessed against the immigration rules".
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-dorset-37656377

attributes.action: To change the laws on criminals being prosecuted on the account of rape.
attributes.background: This petition is to change the minimum jail sentence length and to rule out community service as a legitimate charge. Victims dealing with cases such as this deserve to be able to go about their lives as they wish, without having the fear of running into their offenders.
attributes.additional_details: Personally, I don't think that community service is an appropriate sentence for someone being convicted of rape. The victims and their families would have been put through hell and the perpetrator receiving community service for however long is basically letting them get away with it, when the victims deserve a lot more justice for the crime that was committed.

attributes.action: Make it law to carry a breakdown warning triangle in every motor vehicle.
attributes.background: If a warning triangle is displayed 100 metres behind a broken down vehicle, it will decrease the chances of someone else crashing into it. What if you had broken down somewhere awkward like a roundabout or a bridge without a hard shoulder?
attributes.additional_details:
It is already mandatory in France to carry a warning triangle.

It alerts other road users to a breakdown so they have enough time to react.

It is very effective on motorways where there is no hard shoulder.

It is known to reduce the amount of accidents involving broken down vehicles.

attributes.action: Do not impose the Bedroom Tax on Pensioners
attributes.background: Pensioners have paid Taxes all their working lives now in their latter years with low state Pensions cannot afford to pay an unfair cut in Housing Benefit which is another form of Poll Tax.
attributes.additional_details: The Tory Government is soon to impose the Bedroom Tax on Pensioners by cutting Housing Benefit to OAPS that have extra bedrooms they say people don't use. Some couples need to sleep alone because of different ailments they have so need the extra bedroom, there is not enough Social Housing to rehouse everybody its Social Blackmail which is not Fair on people who have paid Taxes all their working lives and are about to be hit with an unfair Tax in their Twilight Years when they don't need the worry of it all

attributes.action: Abolish psychiatric electroconvulsive therapy – ECT - electroshock to the brain
attributes.background: ECT causes brain cell death, brain bleed and swelling. It can cause permanent memory loss, cognitive impairment and even death. It can trigger suicide. ECT machines have never been independently inspected or approved for medical safety, not even by the regulators for the UK - MHRA or the US – FDA.
attributes.additional_details: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) is a psychiatric procedure where up to 400 volts is put through the brain for up to 8 seconds causing an epileptic fit purportedly to relieve mental distress.   Mainly given to women and the elderly, sometimes to children and often without consent.  Patients are rarely fully informed about the potential harm.  Dr Peter Breggin states ECT produces a ‘closed head injury high’ www.ectresources.org. Abolish ECT. www.speakoutagainstpsychiatry.org

attributes.action: To reduce fraud, Banks must match Name to the A/C No. before Auth. transactions!
attributes.background: Currently UK banks only check if the sort code and account number is correct before a transaction is authorised. This opens vulnerabilities for fraudsters to exploit the system. In some other countries, if the name does not match the account then the transaction is rejected.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government must make this a statutory requirement.

Example case: 
MARY has building work done by JOHN. JOHN's email is compromised by fraudsters who send MARY payment request to be paid into an account who they say is under JOHNS name. MARY makes a bank transfer to the account and puts JOHN SMITH as Payee. Because the account number is correct the payment is accepted by the receiving bank. The actual account holder is JOE BLOG. Money is immediately withdrawn. The banks do not reimburse Mary.

attributes.action: Increase tax allowance to £14,976 per year so minimum wage pay no tax on income
attributes.background: We believe this would encourage people back into full time employment whilst reducing benefits claims to a degree. This action may influence our economy as there would be potential for more disposable income.

attributes.action: Raise the wages for those working in HM Prison Services
attributes.background: The average wage for a Prison officer in the UK is not only low, but is also 10 thousand (in pounds) less than the average paid to prison officers in the USA.
attributes.additional_details: Our Prison officers have a very tough and demanding job. Our Prison officers experience every day things most of us would never have to think about or Imagine. Not to mention the hours they serve, and the unsociable times they serve them through. There have been cuts after cuts with the prison service, and its gone on too far. The ratio of HMP staff to number of prisoners is dangerous. Pay our men and woman in the prison service a fair wage for the hard work that they do! Match the USA average.

attributes.action: Allow orphans to inherit from parents without being subject to inheritance tax.
attributes.background: Currently if you are a single parent and die leaving minor kids, they can only inherit up to £325,000 and anything more than that is taxed at 40%.  In contrast, anything that you leave to a spouse/civil partner is inherited tax free, even if s/he is earning well and/or has sufficient own resources.
attributes.additional_details: It seems fundamentally wrong that helpless, resourceless orphans are treated less well than bereaved spouses/partners.  It is not the mark of a civilized society that the inheritance of a vulnerable, hapless orphan should be raided for tax.  Such a situation also leads dying single parents to enter into contrived marriages or other schemes just to shelter the assets of the estate; and sometimes that situation can go drastically wrong.  Surely the UKs orphans ought to be treated better!

attributes.action: I think that horse owners should have to pick up after their pets.
attributes.background: When you are walking or cycling down a path nothing is more disturbing than a big pile of horse excrement.
attributes.additional_details: I know its not as bad as dog feaces but it is no more pleasant it is unavoidable when on a bike and from my experiences does not clear up very quickly. I think that if a horse owner wants to keep a horse they should be prepared to pick up after them! Instead they are lazy and leave their horses waste in the way of cyclists, walkers, children and other animals.

attributes.action: Send Help For African Droughts
attributes.background: Today, as you are reading this, droughts in Africa are happening, I want your to sign this petition so we can send help to these dying people, everyday children and adults die in Somalia, and there are many more in other countries, no food or not a lot of water, they will not survive!

attributes.action: Scottish Taxpayers be charged tax to cover the cost of another referendum
attributes.background: The UK taxpayers paid for Scotland's last referendum. The Scottish Tax Payer should foot the bill for the next referendum. They are wanting the next referendum before the UK exits the EU and should pay for the cost of their next referendum in an increase in PAYE over the next two years.
attributes.additional_details:
We are in times that most of the UK are experiencing cut backs on public spending, at local Government level to NHS and it would be wrong that while the UK are suffering from these cut backs that Scotland wastes further millions on another referendum so soon after the last referendum.  They are wanting independence by leaving the UK to join the EU that is not independence.

If they insist on another referendum then it should be paid by the Scottish tax payer and in advance.
